page.title: 15THE WEEKEND
page.content: Its Sunday morning and the last chance for a lie in before the start of another hard week. Mum and Dad depart for their regular run in Richmond Park and leave us to come to our own senses. It always seems so hard to cycle to the stables to feed the animals on the day after the night before. Exercising and working with the animals is tiring and Mum and Dad spend the afternoon bowling at the Heathrow Bowl on the outskirts of the airport. Dinner is not the usual 1 o'clock event but it has become later and later and we now sit down to eat at about 6.o' clock along with most of the bowling team. The house is in havoc. At about 10.o'clock the visitors go home and we can sit down to rush what homework has to be done or read the Sunday p@apers before it is Monday.
